data.question: What is the role of the porous coordination network in the experiment?
data.answer: The porous coordination network acts as a heterogeneous catalyst for the trans−cis isomerization of retinal.

data.question: What solvent mixture was used to crystallize the coordination network [(ZnI2)3(TPT)2·x(G)]n?
data.answer: A 4:1 nitrobenzene/methanol solvent mixture was used.

data.question: What happens to the color of the crystals when retinal diffuses into them?
data.answer: The pale-yellow crystals immediately turn orange.

data.question: How was the all-trans/13-cis ratio of retinal determined after the isomerization reaction?
data.answer: The ratio was determined by 1H NMR spectroscopy.

data.question: What was the turnover number estimated for the all-trans to 13-cis isomerization?
data.answer: The turnover number was estimated to be approximately 90 per (ZnI2)3(TPT)2 unit.

data.question: What indicates the presence of retinal in the network pores according to X-ray crystallographic analysis?
data.answer: Two crystallographically independent retinal molecules (A and B) were observed in single crystals of the network.

data.question: What was the outcome when a similar complex with no absorption property for retinal was tested?
data.answer: The similar complex did not show any catalytic activity for the retinal isomerization.

data.question: Why was the experiment carried out under an Ar atmosphere and in the dark?
data.answer: Because retinal is easily photoisomerized, the experiment was conducted under conditions to prevent this.

data.question: What was the effect of changing the solvent to t-BuOH on the guest exchange rate?
data.answer: Changing the solvent to t-BuOH reduced the guest exchange rate.

data.question: What was the purpose of immersing the tiny block-shaped crystals in an orange cyclohexane solution of all-trans retinal?
data.answer: The purpose was to observe the rapid diffusion of retinal into the crystal pores and its isomerization catalyzed by the porous network.

data.question: What was the result of the leaching test?
data.answer: The leaching test indicated the heterogeneous catalysis of the crystals: the all-trans to 13-cis isomerization was hampered when the catalyst crystals were removed.
